session.description: The moderator, Martin Tisne (Omidyar Network), started mentioning that adopting Open Data Charter implies adopting excellence on open data policies and then asked how panelists think that the six principles will help improve open data policies.

tweets.content: @opendatacharter: Charter Track, starting now, will draw together discussions on applying #opendata to key sectors & bringing principles to practice #IODC16

conference_notes:
• -Ana Zúñiga (México City Government) : “If there is a new government in the future who does not support open data, society will ask for it”.
  • Alexsey Vyskub (Ukraine Government) : “Open data is the key to reform Ukraine because open data changes the way we interact with public institutions”.
  • Ania Calderón (Office of the President of Mexico) : ”At an international level, ODC is very important to set up the same initiatives and avoid establishing different, contradictory or even competitive standards”.
  • Edwin Lau (OECD ): “A very useful ODC approach is creating networks of CIOs and managers from different cities and countries to share their knowledge and experiences.
  • Pavel Richter (OKFN) : “Open data is a political process and should be tackled by politicians”.
name: Open Data Charter: Bringing Principles to Practice
